clinical_study.brief_title: Safety and Efficacy of the Combo Bio-engineered Sirolimus-eluting Stent Versus the Nano Polymer-free Sirolimus-eluting Stent in the Treatment of Patients With de Novo Stenotic Lesions
clinical_study.official_title: RECOVERY: A Prospective, Multi-center, Randomized Controlled Trial Evaluating the Safety and Efficacy of the Combo Bio-engineered Sirolimus-eluting Stent Versus the Nano Polymer-free Sirolimus-eluting Stent in the Treatment of Patients With de Novo Stenotic Lesions of Native Coronary Artery

brief_summary.textblock: To evaluate the safety, efficacy and deliverability of the Combo bio-engineered sirolimus-eluting stent versus the Nano polymer-free sirolimus- eluting stents in the treatment of patients with de novo stenotic lesions of native coronary artery.

detailed_description.textblock: This is a prospective, multi-center, open-label, non-inferiority, randomized controlled trial which plans to enroll 436 subjects. All subjects enrolled will be randomly assigned to the test group (n=218) and the control group (n=218). Subjects in the test group and the control group will receive Combo stents and Nano stents respectively.

primary_outcome.description: In-segment late lumen loss (LLL) refers to within the margins of the stent and 5 mm proximal and 5 mm distal to the stent.

secondary_outcome.time_frame: 30 days, 6 months, 12 months and annually up to 5 years
secondary_outcome.description: The device-oriented target lesion failure (TLF) defined as a composite of cardiac death, target vessel myocardial infarction (MI), and ischemia-driven target lesion revascularization (i-TLR)

secondary_outcome.time_frame: 30 days, 6 months, 12 months and annually up to 5 years
secondary_outcome.description: The patient-oriented composite endpoint includes all-cause death, all MIs, or any revascularization

secondary_outcome.measure: In-stent and In-segment minimal lumen diameter (MLD)

secondary_outcome.time_frame: acute (0-24 hours), sub-acute (24 Hours to 30 Days), late (30 Days to 1 year) and very late (1 year to 5 years) period per Academic Research Consortium (ARC) definition criteria
secondary_outcome.description: Definite and probable stent thrombosis (ST) in acute, sub-acute, late and very late period per Academic Research Consortium (ARC) definition criteria

arm_group.description: The Combo Stent is composed of the OrbusNeich R stent™, with an abluminal coating of a bioabsorbable polymer matrix formulated with sirolimus for sustained release, and an anti-CD34 antibody cell capture coating on the luminal surface.
The Nano polymer-free sirolimus-eluting stent produced by LePu medical.
